11.content:
Jake Matthews was miserable. His life wasn't bad, but it wasn't what he wanted it to be. And even though misery loves company, he had no one to be with. For 48 years of his life, life seemed to play jokes on him. He was always chubby, now becoming fatter, he started balding when he was 26, and whenever he tried, he could never get a girl.

Jake Matthews was miserable, but he did have one thing. Unknown to Jake, he had a guardian, maybe an angel, or a demon or what have you, but a guardian who cared, making sure that whenever he said things that started with "I wish.." he got them. Unfortunately for Jake life was about to play a really strange joke on him indeed.


--------------

Jake slumped down on his couch, groaning as he turned on the tv. He had just gotten back from the eighth interview this week, he had been trying to find a job for a month now, and money was starting to get tight. Jake stared blankly at the tv, the words passing through his ears and lost in a haze. Stress was gripping him, very tightly and he sighed.

A commercial for and exercise machine came on and went through it's usual routine, healthy sexy looking people worked out on the machines and the tagline came on screen. "Get ready to start a new life!"

"Huh..." Jake sighed "I wish i could have a new life."

Just a few moments after that everything went black. Jake woke up in a bright well furnished white room, something felt off, and he threw back the sheets and let out a scream, Jake had been changed, and what he saw was an entire new body, complete with new voice, he got his wish, but was he in control, and who was he now?
11.title: Jake

112.content:
Jake heard a beeping of an alarm clock, but it wasn't his, he felt his hand reach over and tap the alarm clock.... on it's own accord. Jake's eyes jolted open, he was in a room he didn't recognize, but before he could take anything in his body threw back the bed sheets and Jake screamed as his new body started moving. His head was now connected to a teenage girl. her curvy body was everything he wanted in a lover when he was in high school. His body walked over to the mirror and he got a good look at her, she stood at 5'4", with C cup breasts, and lightly tanned skin.

Jake didn't understand what was going on, his body moved again.

"STOP!" He screamed, but his body didn't listen. She grabbed a pair of panties and a bra and went to the bathroom. Stripping Jake became aware of every inch of the new body, and how wrong everything felt. She got under the water and he felt the movements of her cleaning herself and finally getting out of the shower and drying off. She walked over to the bedroom again and got dressed, her body hugged by the t-shirt and jeans, she put on her shoes and started walking down the stairs.

Jake for his part was scared and confused, he didn't know what was going on.

"This has got to be a dream!" Jake moaned. "Yeah that's it, a dream, it's all a dream, I'll wake up any minute now."

Jake's new body walked into the kitchen where a woman was standing at the sink and washing dishes.

"LADY! LADY! YOU'VE GOT TO HELP ME!"

She turned around, but instead of shock, she acted as if everything was normal. "Good morning honey, did you sleep well?" Jake just stared at her, and was about to say something, but she interrupted, "That's great honey, now eat your breakfast, you're a growing girl."

Jake was dumbfounded as his new body sat down and grabbed a spoonful of cereal, shoving it in his mouth, and his mouth automatically started to chew against his will. Swallowing he gasped, trying to say something and was forced to eat more. It was as if he was just a passenger to this girl's life.

"Are you and Jeff going out today?" The woman asked.

"JEFF? WHO'S JEFF?" Jake panicked, still trying to grasp what was happening.

"Oh i do love the outdoors, the fresh air, the scenic views..." She turned around and winked at him "The privacy."

"What?" Jake croaked.

"Oh I'm just kidding dear, I know you two will wait for a while until you're through college, but I was your age once."

Just then a car pulled up and a horn honked.

"Oh, speak of Casanova, you have fun now." Jake's body leaped up and ran out the door to a well built man standing next to his car, before Jake could react, he found his lips locked and his body embracing the man. Jake pulled back after the kiss and to his horror he found his mouth speaking for him.

"Baby, we are going to have so much fun!" Jake spoke not in his voice but int he girl's, and he found himself in the car soon enough.

12.content:
Theorizing that travel between realities was possible within one’s lifetime, Dr. Sarah Thierau stepped into her machine, turned it on, and…

...Nothing happened. Damn! What had gone wrong now? This time she had been so sure… Sarah ordered the machine shut down and stepped out of the chamber. The assembled scientists and other staff began to disperse. This had been her life’s work, the focus of her career since she had still been in college. And now that she was so close to seeing it realized, there seemed to be an unlimited number of setbacks waiting to trip her up.

“Do you think the problem is mechanical, or have we miscalculated?” asked Dr. Kim, the project’s second-in-command. Dr. Hyun-sung Kim was a highly motivated, angel-faced scientist from Korea (though her English was flawless) who had joined the project a few years ago and quickly distinguished herself. She was close to Sarah in age and the two had become friends in short order.

“I don’t know,” said Sarah. “We’ll have to check everything.” Frustrating as it was, she couldn’t be too discouraged. They were close, and every try got them closer. And it had taken just a little over ten years to reach this point – Sarah had been fully prepared to be an old woman before her dream was close to reality, or even to die and trust it to the next generation to complete. Instead, it seemed highly likely that she would make the first inter-universal trip herself before her 37th birthday. Her emotions were a balance of anxiety and pride.

Her team spent the rest of the day double-checking and running various diagnostics, but it was obvious that it would be some time before they could give it another try. Sarah excused herself a couple hours early because she had a gala to attend. It was her hope that she could drum up just a little more support for her project by mingling with the stuffed shirts and bigwigs. As close as they were to a breakthrough, a sudden lack of funds or resources could put the whole thing to an unceremonious end.

An hour later, Sarah was at home and nearly ready to leave for the big event. She had squeezed herself into a little black dress, let her hair down, and was now putting on her earrings in front of the mirror. Looking at her reflected face, she hoped she hadn’t overdone it with the eyeliner. Sarah was naturally very attractive, but her job didn’t let her ‘gussy up’ very often. It paid to stay in practice, though, as quite a lot of wealthy donors were secretly dirty old men and ‘feminine charms’ were one advantage she had that many others in her field did not. That was one instance where being a pretty woman was an asset rather than a disadvantage, she supposed.
She adjusted her breasts. “Alright girls,” she said, “let’s see if you can’t get us another couple thousand.”

She was already in her car when she remembered. On her desk back at the office were some important files that she needed to review overnight. She’d been so distracted by the most recent failure, and by the gala looming ahead that night, that she’d forgotten to take them home. Oh well, she thought, I can swing by work and pick them up on my way to the party. It’s not too far out of my way.

The lab was empty and dark when she arrived. She unlocked the door and hurried to her office, the click of her high heels echoing in the empty building. She found the files right where she’d left them, but as she turned to leave, she noticed a peculiar sound. Is that…?

A quick peek into the testing chamber confirmed her suspicions. Somehow, the machine had been turned on. What the hell? Everyone knew to make sure that everything was shut down before they left. It was policy to double-check, and to have others check for you as an extra precaution. There wasn’t a single person working on the project that Sarah didn’t trust to be this careful. Could it have possibly turned on by itself?

Almost unconsciously, Sarah started walking towards the device. However it’d gotten turned on, it was clear she’d have to turn it off herself. The machine was between her and the controls, though, and getting close might be dangerous. She stepped carefully, but the machine’s hum was noticeably getting louder with each step she took. By the time she was next to it, still with half the distance to cross to reach the ‘off’ switch, the hairs on the back of her neck were standing up from a noticeable charge in the air.

Sarah decided to make a break for the switch. The humming was getting louder and louder, and there was a noticeable ionization smell. As she kicked off her shoes and broke into a run, a light started shining from the device. It was only a couple more feet, but the light would reach her before then. The light, now blindingly bright, washed over her with her hand just inches from the switch. Sarah’s body went numb, and her vision went white –

The flash of light faded, revealing the machine alone in a dark room. The machine powered down by itself, and all was quiet again. On the floor between the device and its control console was a pair of discarded high-heeled shoes.
12.title: Sarah

121.content:
Sarah’s vision came back suddenly, but everything was blurred. Her head was swimming. What had happened?

For a second her mind grasped futilely at nothing. Then it all came rushing back. Last night... the machine...where am I?

Immediately she realized that she was in a bed. Her first thought was hospital bed, but a quick glance around told Sarah she was not in a hospital room. This was a private bedroom, but not one she'd ever seen before. Had somebody found her unconscious at the lab and taken her to their house? That didn't make any sense. Why wouldn't they just call an ambulance?

She shifted in the bed to get a better look at the room she was in. As she moved, she realized that something felt very strange. There was a peculiar feeling in her body from the neck down - not quite a tingling, or any other sensation she could easily describe, but there was a definite sense that something was...off. Sarah threw back the covers that were hiding her body from view, and saw:

1212.content:
Throwing off the covers of her bed, saw that she was wearing different underwear from what she’d had on just last night. It didn’t even look like anything she owned – which sort of made sense, in a weird way: after all, this was a room she didn’t recognize, either. Had she been kidnapped? In the back of her mind there was a feeling of foreboding, but right now she had to get her bearings.

Looking down at her body, there was something else that seemed out of place. She had no idea what that might be, but there was a distinct sense of wrongness. Had something…been done to her? She debated calling out, but worried that whoever had moved her – and undressed her – might not be someone she’d want to meet. Sarah put her thoughts toward escaping. There was a window across from the bed that looked out onto a suburban neighborhood. From the looks of it, it seemed like she was on the second story. There was a tree right outside – Sarah wasn’t the most athletic person, but she figured she could probably climb down it if she had to. Should she risk taking the time to get dressed first? Sarah crept to the door and put her ear to it, listening for any indication that there were other people in the house. It was quite to her shock that the voice she heard came from behind her, in the same room.

“Sarah?”

Sarah spun around, heart pounding. She was sure she’d been alone in the room. Had there been someone else in here, hiding? Her racing mind came screeching to a halt when she saw who it was: There, standing next to the bed she’d just gotten out of, was her friend and colleague Hyun-sung Kim.

12121.content: What body does Kim have?
12121.title: Kim's head is also on a different body.

121212.content:
“Kim?” Sarah could hear the uncertainty in her own voice. “What’s going on? What…what are you wearing?”

Dr. Kim was standing in the bathroom door, staring at her desperately confused colleague. She appeared to be wearing a simple white nightgown, but underneath that was what seemed to be some sort of skin-tight brown bodysuit.

“Sarah!” Kim’s stare broke into a huge smile, like someone seeing an old friend for the first time in years. “I can’t believe I’ve finally found you!” Before Sarah could even react, Kim ran forward and embraced her.

“Um…OK,” Sarah was able to blurt out. “You seem like you know what’s going on here. Which makes one of us.” As her friend hugged her she couldn’t help but notice how odd her …weird bodysuit felt. It was just like skin.
Kim’s demeanor turned serious. “What’s the last thing you remember before you woke up here?”

“The device! I came back to get some papers on my way to the party, and it was already on! When I went to go shut it down, it went off, and then… then I woke up here.”

Kim looked thoughtful. “I see. Some people on the team thought you had activated it yourself, but I knew you wouldn’t do anything stupid like that. Well, let me tell you what we know.”

Kim continued. “You’ve probably already guessed, but the machine works. You’ve successfully shifted into an alternate reality. For you this only happened last night, but on our end it’s been months. I went after you as soon as we were sure it was safe, but it took a while to hunt you down.”

Sarah nodded. It hadn’t actually occurred to her initially that the device had actually worked, but she was glad to learn that she hadn’t been kidnapped.

“It seems that the process of dimensional translocation doesn’t work exactly as we had expected, though,” said Kim.

“How do you mean?” asked Sarah. Waking up in a strange bed in her underwear had already tipped her off to that fact, but she was hoping Kim could enlighten her further.

“Well, our expectation was that the entire body would make the shift. Apparently that was not the case.”

“I’m not sure I follow.”

Kim looked surprised. “You mean you haven’t noticed?”

Sarah was becoming agitated again. “Noticed what?”

By way of explanation, Kim gestured at her own body. Sarah stared blankly for a second before she noticed the pores and minute hairs on what she had previously assumed was a bodysuit.

“Oh my God, that’s your skin! What happened??”

“That’s the issue – it seems that, rather than being transported as predicted, you are somehow inserted into someone else’s body and life. The body I’m currently occupying is not my own, as you can see. You might not have noticed because your current host body looks a lot like your original one, but you’re in the same situation.”

“So you mean – but – what? But your face still looks the same! It’s not even the same color as the rest of your body!

“Yes”, Kim sighed. “We’re not sure why or even how, but apparently your head doesn’t change with the body. Though other people don’t seem to notice.” She saw Sarah’s quizzical stare. “Yes, I’ve done this more than once. Looking for you. And trust me,” she added, smiling, “you don’t know how lucky you were to get a body like that on your first try.”
121212.title: Female

1212121.content:
“So you’re saying…”

“Yes?”

“That my head…”

“Yes.”

“Is currently on someone else’s body.”

“That’s correct. I know it’s a lot to handle.”

Sarah turned to look in the mirror across the room. At first glance, she looked normal enough. Her head did look just a tiny bit incongruous, hair and makeup still done up for the party she’d been on her way to. But her body – it seemed normal enough. Was it really possible? She looked back at Kim, with her pale head on its dark brown body. She looked down at herself. Maybe it was her imagination, but the hue of her skin did seem ever-so-subtly different. And there – there was a little mole. Sarah didn’t have that mole. She gasped softly. “I need to sit down,” she said, and promptly did.

“So… who are we?” Sarah asked, looking over her new body.

“I can answer that!” Kim said. “We’ve made some modifications to the technology, so now we can pinpoint where a person comes through – and who they end up as. It took a while to find you, as I said, but now that we have we won’t lose you again.”

“That’s great, but it doesn’t answer my question.”

“Your body’s name is Jocelyn McAllister. She’s 22 and going through beauty school to be a hairdresser. I’m currently her roommate, Donna.”

“Wild… So this body’s 22, huh? I guess I should feel younger or something.”

“As I said, you’re quite lucky to have this body. You can’t imagine some of the bodies I went through looking for you.”

“You’re right, I can’t imagine.” Sarah suddenly realized something that had been bothering her. “Hang on a second. If our machine was supposed to facilitate travel between dimensions, how did I end up teleported onto someone else’s body instead?”

“Well, you did travel between dimensions. Or universes, I should say. We’re both in an alternate reality right now.”

“Really?” Sarah was pleased to learn that the machine had functioned almost correctly. Almost.

“Yes, that’s why I had to go in after you. If you’d remained in the same reality, we could have located you using normal means.”

“That’s true, I guess. You mentioned that other people don’t notice that your head and body don’t match?”

“Correct. Apparently everyone sees you as being your host. So this world should perceive you as Jocelyn McAllister, with nothing unusual. We aren’t sure why.”

Sarah thought. “I suppose it’s possible that we created a new reality, one in which I’ve always been this person. That would explain what happened to the real Jocelyn – she didn’t exist until now.”

Kim nodded. “That’s an interesting theory, but we can’t be sure.”

“We’ll have a lot to research. How are we going to get back?”

Kim’s face had a pained expression.

“How are we going to get back?” Sarah repeated.

“…That’s the problem. I can go back, but I didn’t go in at the same time as you. We still don’t know how to get you out.”

A lump formed in Sarah’s throat. “But,” Kim continued quickly, “now that we know where you are, I can check in on you any time and keep you updated on our progress! There’s hope!”

For a minute Sarah said nothing. “What am I supposed to do in the meantime?” She finally asked. “Do I just pretend to be this Jocelyn person?”

“That’s up to you, I guess. If you do, I can help you out with information about her.”
1212121.title: Kim continues to explain.

12121211.content:
“I’ll do it,” Sarah decided abruptly. “How often do you get the chance to live a different life? Might be fun.”

Kim smiled. “That’s great! I can tell you more about Jocelyn, like where she goes to school, to get you started. And I’ll be back to check in on you and let you know how our work to get you back is going. Just a warning: I might not be Donna again next time. I could appear as anyone at any time.”

“That’s… something to think about,” said Sarah, flatly.

A short time later ‘Jocelyn’ stepped out of her apartment, fully dressed and headed to school. It was only a short ways away, so it would be an easy walk. Sarah didn’t know if Jocelyn had a car, but walking would be good for her anyway. It would give her time to think.
12121211.title: Pretend to be Jocelyn.

12122.content:
“Kim?” Sarah gaped in disbelief. “What the fuck are you doing here?”

Unlike Sarah, Dr. Kim was fully dressed, and wearing her normal lab coat. Sarah felt a little embarrassed to be seen in only her (well, someone’s) underwear, but that couldn’t really be helped under the circumstances.

“Sarah! It is you! Oh God, I’m so glad we found you! I’d hug you if I could, but that’s not really an option…”

Sarah squinted in confusion. Every new development was only bringing a host of new questions. “What the hell are you doing here?” she repeated. “What the hell is going on?”

Kim’s look of joy faded. “Actually, I was hoping you could tell me.” Seeing Sarah’s blank look, she continued. “Sarah, you’ve been missing for a year. The day after you’d last been seen, we came in to find evidence that the machine had been used. We came to the conclusion that you’d used it on your own, but we couldn’t figure out why. Do you remember anything?”

“I didn’t use it myself”, Sarah said, trying to get her memories in order. “I…I came back to the lab because I forgot something, and it was already on. I tried to turn it off, but… there was a flash, and… I’m sorry, did you say a year?”

Kim nodded. “That’s how long it took us before we were ready to send someone after you. I insisted on being the one to go. We were able to pinpoint the first place you’d gone in the inter-dimensional time stream, and they sent me there. So we’ve both come to the same place, but from a year apart. That’s space-time travel for you.” She smiled nervously.

Sarah was about to say something, but Kim continued. “Listen, Sarah… there’s more.” Her tone was ominous. “When you activated – I mean, when the machine was activated, you were phased into an alternate reality. In this timestream, you don’t exist.”

“What? What do you mean?”

“You’re not you. You’ve shifted into someone else’s life. According to my analysis, your name is Jocelyn McAllister.”

“What?” Sarah ran over to the mirror on the far wall. The face reflected was clearly her own. “But I still look like me…Wait. What on Earth?”

Looking herself over in the floor-length mirror, Sarah realized what the strange feeling from earlier had been. Below her neck, her body was a noticeably different skin tone, and there was a birthmark on her hip that she’d never seen before. Looking all over, she was starting to see that every part of her body was subtly different somehow – longer fingers, more muscular legs, a better bust – this wasn’t her body at all!

“Holy shit!” Sarah cried, overcome with wonder. From the neck up, she was still Sarah Thierau. Her face was still made up from last night, and her hair still looked freshly shampooed. She was even wearing the same earrings she’d put on before she’d left for the gala – the gala she’d never gotten the chance to actually go to. Her head was still exactly as it had been ‘last night’, when she’d been caught up in the malfunctioning device. But below the neck, she was Jocelyn McAllister.

“Are you seeing this?” she asked her friend.

“It certainly is incredible,” Kim responded. “Temporo…spatial… Cranial… Substitution? I don't know what to call it. This goes beyond anything we expected.”

“Hey, why don’t you look like this? You look like you have your normal body still.”
“Because I’m not physically here. This is just a projection, that only you can see. It took a few months of tweaking to make something like this possible, but we thought it might be safer.”

Sarah sat down on the bed. She (and Kim) were without a doubt the first human beings to ever be in this situation. So why did it seem so familiar?

“So what do we do now?” she asked her friend’s hologram.
12122.title: She still has her own body.

choices: Try to learn more about her new life.
Just stay home and hope no one comes by.
121222.content:
“We’re working on a way to get you back. I’ll be popping in and out to check on you – until then, I suggest you sit tight.”

“Sit tight? Easy for you to say! What am I supposed to do? I don’t know anything about this woman! What’s my job now, if I even have one? Am I married? Do I have kids? I – “

Dr. Kim calmly interrupted her. “According to our data, Jocelyn is a hairdresser. She has a boyfriend but was never married. I don’t remember all of the information right now, but I can go back and get any other data we have if you need it. Don’t worry about that.”

“OK,” Sarah responded, “but how can I even pass myself off as this person? It’s not as if I’m just inhabiting her body – I still have my own head. I can’t just walk into her job and act like nothing’s different! Hell, people probably aren’t even going to tell that I’m supposed to be this Jocelyn person, they’ll just think I’m some random stranger.”

“I wish I could help you there,” said her friend, “but I’m afraid I don’t have any answers for that. Considering that the reality you’re currently in ‘thinks’ of you as Jocelyn, it’s possible that people will just accept you as her. But we don’t know that for sure. We won’t know the truth of that hypothesis until it’s been tested.” Suddenly Dr. Kim looked over her shoulder. “I-I-I’m sorry, I have to go now. I’ll be back as soon as I can.”

“What? Wait!” Cried Sarah.

“I’ll be back to check on you tonight!” said Kim. “That’s ‘tonight’ in your time! About twelve hours from now for you!” Her hologram begin to sputter and fade like a TV program being interrupted by static. “Until then, I suggest you try to act normally! Good luck!”

“Twelve hours? But what if I need you before then? Hey, come back!”

But it was too late. Kim was gone, leaving Sarah all alone again in a strange room and a strange life.

“Well, some help that was,” she mumbled to herself. “She said I’m supposed to be a hairdresser, but she didn’t even say where.”
121222.title: Kim has no idea.

However you started to learn and grow with every fiber if your brain working its tail off you manage to do a tremendous feat! Lift one finger up and immediately put it down..... hooray! After a painful 6 hours you finqlly manage to get up and walk over to the mirror in the room, you see a beautiful brunette staring blankly back with her mouth open and drool pooling out.

You deduce that this is the scientist who had spent her career trying to understand flys, only to have her body stolen by one. You spend the next hour closing your mouth and swallowing your gulp of saliva that you had made, and walk over to her door, you spend about 20 minutes figuring out doors and how to open but these baby steps would all pay off.... hopefully. You walk out and see many of her coworkers working vigorously, they would say stuff like "hey Sam" or "what up ,girl" you would simply stare at them, not yet knowing how to respond or talk with words yet.

You walk over to the exit and through the parking lot until you get to her car and open the door then sit down. You just let your mind wander a minute and soon a tiny spark of personality pops up in your head, your survival had no need for a personality, so it tries to get rid of it but the newly formed personality wins over survival and creates emotions which teach your primitive brain words. Then the ability of speech is granted to you, then fianlly it escalates all the way to your car which this body just needed a little push to get started.

You start to speak in her feminine voice while you drive out of the parking lot and onto the parkway. You are going on a ride.

Where do you go now (this location depends on your personality)

info.description:
So a while back I discovered the weird world of headswap stories here on Writing.com, and decided that I wanted in. I've always found stories of body-switching to be both frightening and attractive at the same time, and the 'head swap' angle provided an interesting new take that I couldn't resist. So I thought I'd start my own, and see where it goes.

General Outline

Basically, the main character finds themselves in a vaguely Quantum Leap-style situation, where they travel from body to body. The exact specifics of how this works and why it happens are up to you. Other characters may end up 'traveling' along with them, if you like. Non-human swaps are also welcome.

There are four characters to choose from in the beginning, but you should feel free to create others if you wish. (I try to give equal representation to males and females, as I believe the latter are under-represented in this genre, but that's just me. Create whatever characters you like.) The four starting characters are:

Jake Matthews, 48

Sarah Thierau, 35

Gary Martinsberg, 20

Chelsea Taylor, 16

As I said, there will be options to create other characters, and more could be added to an existing storyline as well. Beyond that, it's pretty much anything goes. See you on the other side (of the link)!
